page.title: 04MYTHS & LEGENDS IN N.BRISTOL
page.content: Due to rapid growth of relatively new communities few ancient customs survive except in church ritual.Modern ones are street parties for royal occasions,day trips,concerts, pantomimes for elderly people & school children,{funfair}on Horfield Common, Bristol{marathon,}half marathon at Henbury,Lanercost Fair,Southmead Festival,Blaise Fair,schools' fairs, Canford Carnival - a round table event.Some 16th century names persist, e.g.Nelmes Boyce,also old field & area names,Brentry-burnt tree,Botany Bay Royalls,Southmead,Chock(chalk)Lane. Road names-Channels Hill; Passage Rd, the old way to Aust.Well known locals live on in Trevelyan Walk,Langfield, Lovering.{Goram the giant}lived in Blaise Woods-you can see his chair & soap dish.Henbury Manor Gdns boast a ghost.1682 ghost sighted PenPark Hole.
